SOURCE: AFP; AP; Cabo Ligado; Club Mozambique; Pinnacle News
NOTES: On 26 March 2021, members of an Islamist militia in Palma (Palma, Cabo Delgado) attacked civilians for a third day. Two thirds of the city were set on fire. Around 200 people including international and Mozambican workers were trapped inside The Amarula hotel. Dyck Advisory Group (DAG)'s helicopters helped to evacuate Mozambican workers/internationals out of the Amarula hotel. A convoy was attacked after it left the hotel and at least seven expatriates/Mozambican workers were killed. Tens of civilians were decapitated or shot, and at least 21 members of the Mozambican Defense and Security Forces were killed during the attacks on separate days. Members of the Islamist Militia have reportedly taken control of two vessels off Palma, firing on a third. Fatalities coded as 31 and split across three days.

NOTES: On 26 March 2021, in Monywa town (Monywa Township, Monywa District, Sagaing Region), in the early morning, security forces (assumed to be police and military) broke into houses, kicked down doors and arrested about 15 men. Myanmar military and police demanded a ransom of Ks.500,000 to 5,000,000 for each arrestee.

SOURCE: Myanmar Now; VOA; Assistance Association for Political Prisoners; Democratic Voice of Burma; AFP; Irrawaddy
NOTES: On 26 March 2021, in Myeik town (Myeik Township, Myeik District, Tanintharyi Region), about 200 people including university students held a demonstration against the Myanmar military coup and in support of the civil disobedience movement. Demonstrators were reportedly wielding shields and homemade rifles. More than 100 military and police forces were deployed to intervene, firing rubber bullets and live rounds to crack down on the demonstration. Police reportedly stole two ambulances from firefighters and arrested four firefighters who were on their way to rescue injured people. Two hours later, demonstrators launched a motorcade rally and security forces gave chase and fired at them. Police were also kicking and beating up people with batons before loading them into a prison truck. 35 people were arrested. In total, VOA reported that at least six were killed while AAPP, Myanmar Now and Irrawaddy reported that at least four people were killed, and 10 others were injured. Two of the bodies were reportedly taken away by security forces. [size=no report]

ACTOR2: Police Forces of the United States (2021-)
NOTES: Interception: On 24 March 2021, police arrested a 22-year-old Black male after he walked into a Publix in Atlantic Station in Atlanta (Georgia) wearing body armor and carrying an AR-15. After he was detained, police seized five more guns, including a 12-gauge shotgun, three semi-automatic pistols, and a chrome revolver - all of which were loaded - as well as several magazines. This incident follows the mass shooting at a grocery store in Colorado on Monday and multiple mass shootings at spas in the Atlanta area the week before. He has been charged with five counts of criminal attempt to commit a felony and six counts of possessing a weapon in attempt to commit certain felonies.

Around 24 March 2021 (as reported), in El Espinillo (Chaco), residents protested with roadblocks against the installation project of Chinese mega pig farms in the area. Protesters expressed their concern, claiming that big amounts of soybeans, corn and millions of litres of water would be needed to feed the animals. In addition, protesters asked for piped water to be provided from the government. [size=no report]

SOURCE: Irrawaddy; Assistance Association for Political Prisoners; Myanmar Now

At least six people were severely injured. [size=no report]

SOURCE: Democratic Voice of Burma; Myanmar Now
NOTES: On 21 March 2021, in Dawei town, Dawei township (Dawei district, Tanintharyi Region), two men in plainclothes (later identified as military soldiers) riding a motorcycle entered a neighbourhood where they were stopped by members of the neighbourhood night watch. The two men reportedly drove their motorcycle into the night watchmen. The confrontation escalated where one of the plainclothes men were beaten to death. A card on his body later identified him as a military soldier. The second soldier reportedly died of his injuries the next day.

SOURCE: Democratic Voice of Burma; Assistance Association for Political Prisoners

SOURCE: Assistance Association for Political Prisoners; Myanmar Now

SOURCE: Assistance Association for Political Prisoners; Myanmar Now; Democratic Voice of Burma; Channel News Asia

AAPP, Myanmar Now and DVB reported that a young man was shot in the head and killed. Nine others were injured, including four in critical condition. Residents continued demonstrating later in the day despite the fatality. State media claimed that men on motorcycles attacked a member of the security forces who later died. Two fatalities coded in total. [size=thousands]

Around 21 March 2021 (as reported), a group of sons of former anti-colonial fighters held a protest sit-in in front of the Organization of the Mujahidiin Centre in Khenchela (Khenchela) to denounce the offensive comments against anti-colonial fighters made by the leader of the organization. On 21 March 2021, around 6500 people protested in Marseille against coronavirus-related measures implemented by the government. They called for a more democratic system where they could have the choice to respect or not the measures. They were dressed for the occasion as if they were at the carnival. 9 people were arrested for failing to comply with ongoing health measures. [size=around 6500]

On 21 March 2021, hundreds of protesters gathered outside the Civic Hall in Leeds to protest against the Police, Crime, Sentencing and Courts Bill which seeks to impose harsher penalties on attendees of non-violent protests. Police were observing the protest but did not make any arrests. [size=hundreds]

On 21 March 2021, in Brasilia, Distrito Federal, about 100 business workers gathered in front of the Governor's house to protest against social distancing measures adopted in the city to prevent the spread of the coronavirus. [size=about 100]

NOTES: On 21 March 2021, the OSCE SMM observed a total of 1 explosions involving unknown weapons near Pyshchevyk.

Around 21 March 2021, applicants of a social housing program held a protest sit-in in Damous (Tipaza, Damous) to denounce their exclusion from the list of the beneficiaries of the social housing program. [size=no report]

On 21 March 2021, in Daung Shaung village, Launglon town (Launglon township, Dawei District, Tanintharyi Region), police and military forces set fire to a family home at midnight, killing a child and injuring six others. It was reported that a family member was out on neighbourhood night watch patrol when the house was set on fire. It was not clear why the family was targeted.

On 21 March 2021, people, including temporary workers, students, and employees of the entertainment and cultural industries, occupied a theater in Toulon. They protested against the forced closure of the arts sector due to coronavirus-related measures implemented by the government and unemployment benefit reforms. Protesters called for the right to reopen their businesses. They also demanded better working conditions and the reopening of universities. This demonstration is part of a national movement of occupation of theaters throughout the country. [size=no report]

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Labour Group (United States); Police Forces of the United States (2021-); GOP: Republican Party
NOTES: On 21 March 2021, people, led by members of police officer unions and Republican lawmakers, rallied San Antonio (Texas) in support of police unions' bargaining power and against a proposition that would remove San Antonio Police Officers Association's right to collective bargain with the city. [size=no report]

On 21 March 2021, terminated workers protested in front of a Korean energy company in an unspecified location north of Diwaniya city. The protesters are recently terminated employees of the company who demand their jobs back. Coded as provincial capital Diwaniya city. [size=no report]

On 21 March 2021, at least 15 people rallied and staged a caravan in San Diego (California) in support of the Black Lives Matter movement and against anti-Asian racism, which has increased during the coronavirus. [size=at least 15]

NOTES: On 21 March 2021, in Sao Cristovao, Sergipe, an inmate exchanged fire with two prison guards inside a detainment facility. The inmate grabbed the firearm from one of the guards and opened fire against them, who fired back. The inmate and one guard were killed, the second guard was injured. 2 fatalities.

On 21 March 2021, around Burruyacu municipality (Tucuman), hundreds of people marched from El Puestito location to Burruyacu to demand justice for a young woman who was group raped in the previous week. In El Puestito, they also demanded justice for a girl who reported her stepfather for sexual assault. The police was present and relatives of the accused ones insulted the protesters but no violence was reported. [size=hundreds]

The riot erupted after security services removed shop stalls which violated zoning codes in Basrah City. The rioters demand an alternative arrangement for their stalls. [size=no report]

NOTES: On 21 March 2021, BSF of India shot at a suspected Pakistani intruder along the India-Pakistan border in Anupgarh town (Sri Ganganagar, Rajasthan). The intruder was killed in the incident.

On 21 March 2021, around General San Martin municipality (Buenos Aires), dozens of relatives and neighbors blocked streets to demand justice for a man who was killed by the police on the previous day. On 21 March 2021, family members of a woman held a protest demonstration after the woman died due to the alleged negligence of the doctors in Larkana city (Larkana, Sindh). [size=no report]
